alert.note: Alert for City of Chesapeake; City of Norfolk; City of Portsmouth (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 28 at 1:40PM EDT until August 28 at 4:45PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wakefield has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The Northwestern City of Chesapeake in southeastern Virginia... The City of Norfolk in southeastern Virginia... The City of Portsmouth in southeastern Virginia... * Until 445 PM EDT. * At 140 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain falling across the warned area. Up to 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Heavy rain producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Virginia Beach, Downtown Portsmouth, Downtown Norfolk, Old Dominion University, Norfolk State University, Churchland, Norfolk, Chesapeake, Portsmouth, Suffolk, Ghent, Cradock, Norview, Norfolk NAS, Western Branch, Bowers Hill, South Norfolk, Portlock, Wards Corner and Willoughby Spit. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

area.areaDesc: City of Chesapeake; City of Norfolk; City of Portsmouth
